title: (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) and the Transport (Delegation of Ministerial Functions)
heading: 1. These Rules may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships)
text_raw:
1. These Rules may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) 

(Amendment) Rules 2022.
text_norm: 1 rule may cited merchant shipping (passenger ships) (amendment) rule 2022

title: (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) and the Transport (Delegation of Ministerial Functions)
heading: 2. Schedule 1 to the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) Rules 2020 (S.I.
text_raw:
2. Schedule 1 to the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) Rules 2020 (S.I. 
No. 640 of 2020) is amended, in the Sea Area entry entitled South Coast of 
Ireland, by substituting for the matter in the first column – 

(a) 

(b) 

in the second last entry “Toe Head to Fastnet Rock”, and 

in the last entry “Fastnet Rock to Streek Head”. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 8 February 2022 

HILDEGARDE NAUGHTON, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Transport. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 11th February, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [49] 3
text_norm: 2 schedule 1 merchant shipping (passenger ships) rule 2020 (s.i no 640 2020) amended sea area entry entitled south coast ireland substituting matter first column - (a) (b) second last entry toe head fastnet rock last entry fastnet rock streek head  given hand 8 february 2022 hildegarde naughton minister state department transport notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 11th february 2022 49 3

title: (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)) and the Transport (Delegation of Ministerial Functions)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Rules amend Schedule 1, Sea Areas, to the Merchant Shipping (Passenger 
Ships) Rules 2020 (S.I. No. 640 of 2020) in relation to two Sea Area locations 
off the South Coast of Ireland. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [49]
